intro: Hetaeria uncinata, commonly known as the hooked hetaeria, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a mild, spicy scent when crushed. Hetaeria uncinata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
